item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

kthnx bullzeye that should make it work better[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 02:25:49 PM[/size][hr]also, i didn’t use the whole thing i just used a majority of it so none of what was behind it got into the bitmap

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Suggestion: Don’t use the whole picture. Use just the center, or wherever the most detail is. Otherwise, it might not find it.

EDIT: Also, if you want it to tell you how many times, you were very close. Keep what you had but make it do [scar]WriteLn(‘This script has opened the browser ’ + inttostr(i) + ’ times.’);[/scar]

Ahh jeez EDIT2: Where you put [scar]if(findbitmap(otherfirefoxbitmap, w, z))then
clickmouse(w, z, true)
clickmouse(w, z, true)[/scar] Make it [scar]else if(findbitmap(otherfirefoxbitmap, w, z))then
begin
clickmouse(w, z, true)
clickmouse(w, z, true)
end;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

oh yeah… i accidentally left i in there from when it was a script that clicks the firefox thing perpetually and tells you how many times it opened firefox… ill delete that[br][size=1]Posted at: September 11, 2006, 07:49:57 PM[/size][hr]here’s the version with bitmaps:[scar]program New;
var
firefoxbitmap, x, y, otherfirefoxbitmap, w, z :integer;
begin
otherfirefoxbitmap := BitmapFromString(17, 19, ‘447BA391867’ +
‘0DBA55AD5BA814D88B456B6E953B5E84DA5D83D79AC396FA33A70’ +
‘A33A70A2386D9F285E8E124875E8DE63FBD033C58847EA9637D79’ +

‘15E83487CB14E98CF4B93CB458DC54FB0E64FB3E94FB3E84BA6DB’ +
‘2E4C832E4D8428457921314CDDDA45DF7A16DF791686573F3E518’ +
‘14F83B74D97CD4B97CF4B99D24B9DD64CACE34CB0E64BAEE54497’ +
‘CF2E508A36699F265483747544DE7515DF7814B13709AE451DC16’ +
‘63149372F3975A04492CC4696D147A1DB46ABE346A9E246A8E043’ +
‘9DD747A1DA3B8DC4245D82DF751DE0791EB43C0CD4682EE85D0BE’ +
‘7B27730698F3F8DC64292CF4299D53285B9296C9E3482B7429FD9’ +
‘429CD7368ECB377192DF751DE17921E59A5BF1D19AE3D2A0577F8’ +
‘A317EAE3B8BC63886C2307DB42975AA1D55851C5080368AC43893’ +
‘D12D86C72B5E87E0781FE5862DEA953CB79D785C6D6E286F98338’ +
‘CC4388DC93181BC1D5C8F174F8117497A174575205D922D87CA18’ +
‘569807245CE6862CEB973DF1A74B857A5A22558127407A2F69A73’ +
‘48BCA2978B313487A114374113E700D3868154E862A80C3195290’ +
‘1B4F87C0561FB15E2BAD834C88786220326C253979308CCB308AC’ +
‘A2E8ACC1A5D95093467073062052A5C052556092A5D0824562E5B’ +
‘889C1B03361D2914264D18265920357425589B2A83C62A82C62A8’ +
‘1C6175791052A5B052657042253041D4D03174584815D97773DAF’ +
‘2A036D493A1C366E1D256322488A2A7ABE2A7BBF2A7BBF2A7ABE2’ +
‘269A9042151041E4E031A4A03154407194888825DFACC3CC33902’ +
‘DE711A805B4D1E28691F296C406592987658BD844AAD8F6337608’ +
‘A0A285C031544021140020D3B0A1A4A8A815BFEF578D74901DE68’ +
‘13DF741CD37122C17232E18028E18129E2842CE39038E09E49131’ +
‘637020C3A01093601053312265B978350FFFF92E25503D85409C2’ +
‘5013DA6E1ADF751DDF771FD36518C3501393451782552D110D2B0’ +
‘10431010431030835795D41CFA235FFFE70E15D0AE16814B43F10’ +
‘9417049F2307A9300A9D371142232501031A01032201042B01043’ +
‘0050B3C2A2B53825F39FACF0EFDF913E06D16E0701AB466251C12’ +
‘212210202714220D183D04082901032901042D070B3A070B3C202’ +
‘2592D2E67E59017F6D205F8E208808080000000E2832BBE74310C’ +
‘1541181D4C171F591F2669181E5C151A56181D5813133F0C0B32A’ +
‘56132E89220EFB50CF5CF17FFFFFF000000E2872EE38A31DB8634’ +
‘8259406C4E473F335C3C2E625B3D5858373C8B542DD47E2DE2862’ +
‘DE48D25EBA00BFBEE4C’);
firefoxbitmap := BitmapFromString(10, 9, ‘E3922AE68D26A855’ +
‘182341605292BA7DB9D66495B6265681486471ECB23CE6912AE68’ +
‘F2DE98B3CA56F373F799F58A6D158A7D42E7FB51A507EE6A531E5’ +
‘8A25E47D1DCA81381A4B742567932B9CCE3B9ECB21608DD0C26DF’ +
‘2D05FE486234C3D39122D4B11385E1F618B0782C020618A174D77’ +
‘68715BFBCD4AE1812771462C14304E994717744D35184E790562A’ +
‘612436F45554EFCCE4AEA8923EE7E1EDD782BEB812BEF9B52383B’ +
‘490B538F094881292F2FE9BB49E88D25EA8821974923422C340A3’ +
‘4600A3F720D2E52221C1ECF802FFFDF66E68321E68B25E87B1A44’ +
‘38370E2238192025411D13F8AF44FCD15BFFD562D55B13E58121E’ +
‘68321E68321E78D27ED9F35ED9F35FBCB56F8BD49C76F2E’);
if(findbitmap(firefoxbitmap, x, y))then
begin
clickmouse(x, y, true)
end;
if(findbitmap(otherfirefoxbitmap, w, z))then
begin
clickmouse(w, z, true)
clickmouse(w, z, true)
end;
writeln(‘firefox has been opened’)
end.[/scar]

item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

And also, you’re not even using i.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

That uses Coords though. Not everyone has a Firefox icon at that point nor the same screen resolution you made the script with. Sooo to get what you really want, you should learn bitmaps. They are really easy.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox opener
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

heh. im still doing simple scripts this one opens firefox when its in the first quicklaunch spot on windows 98 skin. [scar]Program openfirefox_w98;
//this opens firefox when you have windows 98 skin.
begin
clickmouse(69,753, true);
writeln(‘I opened firefox for you.’);
end.[/scar]
this does the same thing but when you’re on the windows XP skin[scar]Program openfirefox_wXP;
//this opens firefox when you have windows XP skin.
begin
clickmouse(113,754, true);
writeln(‘I opened firefox for you.’);
end.[/scar]

Read full topic
